memberdef.name: ISCOLL
memberdef.initializer: ( (rg->eType == erotgFLEX) || (rg->eType == erotgFLEXT) || (rg->eType == erotgFLEX2) || (rg->eType == erotgFLEX2T) || (rg->eType == erotgRMPF) || (rg->eType == erotgRM2PF) )

memberdef.argsstring: (t_rot *rot, rvec f[], t_commrec *cr, gmx_int64_t step, real t)
memberdef.name: add_rot_forces

briefdescription.para: Add the enforced rotation forces to the official force array.

detaileddescription.para: Adds the forces from enforced rotation potential to the local forces and sums up the contributions to the rotation potential from all the nodes. Since this needs communication, this routine should be called after the short range forces have been evaluated (in order not to spoil cycle counts). This routine also outputs data to the rotation output files (e.g. the potential, the angle of the group(s), and torques).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to all the enforced rotation data.
The local forces to which the rotational forces have to be added.
Pointer to MPI communication data.
The time step, used for output.
Time, used for output.

simplesect.para: The potential energy of the rotation potentials.

memberdef.name: init_rot_group

briefdescription.para: Make a selection of the home atoms for all enforced rotation groups.

detaileddescription.para: This routine is similar to dd_make_local_pull_groups, but works only with domain decomposition. It should be called at every domain decomposition.

parameterdescription.para: Structure containing domain decomposition data.
Pointer to all the enforced rotation data.

Number of entries in the fnm structure.
The filenames struct containing also the names of the rotation output files.

The positions of all MD particles.

Molecular topology.
Needed to open the rotation output xvgr file.

memberdef.name: do_rotation

detaileddescription.para: This is the main enforced rotation module which is called during every time step. Here the rotation potential as well as the resulting forces are calculated.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to MPI communication data.
Struct containing MD input parameters, among those
Simulation box, needed to make group whole.
The positions of all the local particles.
Time.
The time step.
During the potential calculation the wallcycles are counted. Later they enter the dynamic load balancing.
After domain decomposition / neighbor searching several local arrays have to be updated (masses, shifts)
